alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Moses Lake Area; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 4:15PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN DOUGLAS...SOUTH CENTRAL CHELAN AND WEST CENTRAL GRANT COUNTIES... At 414 PM PST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from 12 miles south of Stevens Pass to near Ephrata. The heavy snow is nearly stationary. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. Locations impacted include... Wenatchee, East Wenatchee, Ephrata, Quincy, Cashmere, Leavenworth, Rock Island, East Wenatchee Bench, Lakeview, South Wenatchee, West Wenatchee, Sunnyslope, Soap Lake, Mission Ridge, Dryden, Malaga, Laveview Park, Palisades, Monitor, and Peshastin. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 99 and 134. U.S. Highway 97 in Washington between mile markers 164 and 184. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes. &&

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Moses Lake Area; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
